intro: Eleocharis kleinii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and small, spike-like inflorescences. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, preferring moist to water-saturated soils. The plant has thin, cylindrical stems that are often reddish in color and bear tiny, spike-like clusters of flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that are usually green or brown. Eleocharis kleinii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
